citations.narrative:
The licensee did not create and maintain a medical record after treating a male Havanese, “Archie” #9673, for urinary and
ear problems. On 10/29/24, a routine physical examination revealed a urinary issue with the dog. The licensee brought
the dog into the Attending Veterinarian’s (AV) clinic on 11/6/24 for further workup. The AV diagnosed two issues and
discharged the dog with three different medications. The inspector called the AV's office to confirm these details. The
licensee reports he completed all medications as prescribed, however, there is no medical record documenting this
treatment plan. Accurate medical records help to ensure dogs at licensed facilities are receiving adequate veterinary care.
Correct by ensuring that the facility keep copies of medical records which accurately identify the animal, the problem
identified, examination findings, test results, plan for treatment and care, and treatment procedures when performed.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by June 23, 2025, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
